informacion.referencia: Triatomini Jeannel, 1919, p. 176; Usinger, 1944, p. 36. Triatominae Pinto, 1926c, p. 485. Small- large-sized Triatominae (9.5-42.0 long). Body integument smooth torugose, small setiferous granules. Body glabrous hirsute. Antenniferous tubercles apical spinelike projection. Antenna inserted close anterior margin eye center anterior half anteocular region head. Genae falling short surpassing level apex peus, widened base, narrow . Ocelli situated eyes, cases conspicuous elevations, interocular sulcus, developed. Head setiferous callosities eyes. Second antennal segment 4-10 trichobothria arranged row length segment. Remaining setae second antennal segment uniform size. Corium veins distinct. Abdomen cases well-developed dorsal ventral connexival segments, covered urosternites; cases, dorsal connexival segments fused urotergites, ventral connexival segments developed obsolescent, case dorsal ventral surface abdomen separated wide membranous area. Genitalia male. Articulatory apparatus basal plate bridge. Basal plate struts narrow, rodlike, elongate, separate, extending entire length phallosoma, fused not. Dorsal sclerotization phallosoma large, subsemi-elliptical. Vesica sclerotized cases. Fifth instar nymph: Body surface granulose rugose, glabrous short setae, setae long, spinulose; head convex ; genae projecting level apex peus; eyes situated middle head; antenniferous tubercles prominent apicolateral process; fourth antennal segment longer preceding; fourth fourth antennal segments annulate; stridulatory sulcus present genera (except Linshcosteus, genus abbreviated rostrum); fore mid femora slender incrassate, denticles; femora trichobothria; fore tarsi shorter half length tibiae; abdomen series large tubercles midline. First instar nymph: Head, thorax legs dark light-colored annuli, mottled; setae simple spinulose; fourth antennal segment longer first, second combined; stridulatory sulcus present, absent; mesonotum longer midline sides; metanotal plates large, distance plates varied; femora trichobothria; hind tarsi numerous long, delicate sensory hairs; setae urotergites arranged transversal rows, irregular rows. Eggs laid .

Rhodnius Stal, 1859. Other genus included: PsammolestesBergroth, 1911. DISTRIBUTION: Southern Mexico, Central America, South America Argentina. BIOLOGY: In birds nests palm trees; species associated mammals, peridomestic domestic. OBSERVATIONS: This tribe contains related genera. The postocular callosities, short ancillary series trichobothria second antennal segment, modified basal plate struts synapomorphic characters shared triatomine genus, sufficient characterize tribe. Carcavallo-(1976) included Psammolestiini list triatomine tribes Americas. There statement giving differential characters taxon, reference statement, Psammolestiini proposed replacement name; therefore, Psammolestiini considered nomennudum.
